docs.snippet: Tim Burke of Deadspin is known for his ability to capture the moment — whether as a still, a video clip or a GIF — better, faster, more frequently and from more sports events than just about anyone....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tim Burke of Deadspin is known for his ability to capture the moment — whether as a still, a video clip or a GIF — better, faster, more frequently and from more sports events than just about anyone.
docs.abstract: Tim Burke, editor at sports Web site Deadspin, is known for his ability to capture the moment better, faster, more frequently and from more sports events than just about anyone.

headline.main: Maker of Animated GIFs Waits for Offbeat Moments

docs.snippet: As Syria moves toward destroying its chemical stockpile, some say the credit lies with doctors who risked their lives — and confronted questions of medical ethics — to expose the weapons’ use....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Syria moves toward destroying its chemical stockpile, some say the credit lies with doctors who risked their lives — and confronted questions of medical ethics — to expose the weapons’ use.
docs.abstract: Many of Syria's doctors have had to risk their lives or confront ethical quandaries in order to gather evidence of chemical weapons use in country, and some say that credit for pushing Pres Bashar al-Assad to give up his arsenal is theirs.

headline.main: In Syria, Doctors Risk Life and Juggle Ethics
headline.print_headline: In Syria, A Quandary For Doctors

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Washington and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and ANNE BARNARD

docs.snippet: For this week’s roundup of grammar, style and other editing missteps, I turn once again to the popular After Deadline Quiz. Try to identify at least one problem in each of the passages....
